Key Match Events: Spinner Keshav Maharaj bowled a six-run, two-wicket final over.
South Africa held off Bangladesh by four runs.
Bangladesh needed 11 from the last six deliveries to register a famous win.
Taskin Ahmed faced the last ball, a full toss by Maharaj, and managed only one run.
South Africa defended its lowly total of 113-6 and restricted Bangladesh to 109-7.
Maharaj finished with 3-27 in four overs.
Kagiso Rabada took 2-19 and Anrich Nortje took 2-17.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa firmed top spot in Group D with a third win and was in pole position to secure a Super Eight spot.
Bangladesh's first loss in two matches kept it in second place.
